meanings.definition: used before countable or singular nouns referring to people or things that have not already been mentioned
examples: a man/horse/unit
an aunt/egg/hour/X-ray

meanings.definition: used before uncountable nouns when these have an adjective in front of them, or phrase following them
examples: a good knowledge of French
a sadness that won't go away

meanings.definition: used to show that someone or something is a member of a group or profession
examples: Their new car's a BMW.
He's a teacher.

meanings.definition: used in front of two nouns that are seen as a single unit
examples: a knife and fork

meanings.definition: used before someone's name to show that the speaker does not know the person
examples: There's a Mrs. Green here to see you.

meanings.definition: abandon somebody to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for, with no intention of returning
examples: The baby had been abandoned by its mother.
People often simply abandon their pets when they go on vacation.

meanings.definition: to leave a thing or place, especially because it is impossible or dangerous to stay
examples: Snow forced many drivers to abandon their vehicles.
He gave the order to abandon ship

meanings.definition: to stop supporting or helping someone; to stop believing in something
examples: The country abandoned its political leaders after the war.
By 1930 he had abandoned his Marxist principles.

meanings.definition: abandon something to stop doing something, especially before it is finished; to stop having something
examples: They abandoned the game because of rain.
She abandoned hope of any reconciliation.
We had to abandon any further attempt at negotiation.

meanings.definition: abandon yourself to something (literary) to feel an emotion so strongly that you can feel nothing else
examples: He abandoned himself to despair.

meanings.definition: left and not wanted, not used, or no longer needed
examples: an abandoned car/house
The child was found abandoned but unharmed.
There was an abandoned grocery cart in the middle of the road.

meanings.definition: (of people or their behavior) wild; not following accepted standards
[singular] ability to do something the fact that someone or something is able to do something
examples: The system has the ability to run more than one program at the same time.
Everyone has the right to good medical care regardless of their ability to pay.
A gentle form of exercise will increase your ability to relax.

meanings.definition: [countable, uncountable] a level of skill or intelligence
examples: Almost everyone has some musical ability.
He was a man of extraordinary abilities.
students of mixed abilities
A woman of her ability will easily find a job.
I try to do my job to the best of my ability (= as well as I can).

meanings.definition: able to do something (used as a modal verb) to have the skill, intelligence, opportunity, etc. needed to do something
examples: You must be able to speak French for this job.
A viral illness left her barely able to walk.
I didn't feel able to disagree with him.
Will you be able to come?

meanings.definition: intelligent; good at something
examples: the ablest student in the class
We aim to help the less able in society to lead an independent life.

meanings.definition: a little more or less than; a little before or after
examples: It costs about $10.
They waited (for) about an hour.
He arrived (at) about ten.

meanings.definition: nearly; very close to
examples: I'm just about ready.
This is about the best we can hope for.

meanings.definition: (technology or formal) facing the opposite direction
examples: He brought the ship about.

meanings.definition: at or to a higher place or position than something or someone
examples: The water came above our knees.
We were flying above the clouds.
the people in the apartment above mine
A captain in the navy ranks above a captain in the army.
They finished the year six places above their local rivals.

meanings.definition: more than something; greater in number, level, or age than someone or something
examples: Inflation is above 6%.
Temperatures have been above average.
We cannot accept children above the age of 10.

meanings.definition: of greater importance or of higher quality than someone or something
examples: I rate her above most other players of her age.

meanings.definition: too good or too honest to do something
examples: She's not above lying when it gets her out of trouble.
He's above suspicion (= he is completely trusted).

meanings.definition: (of a sound) louder or clearer than another sound
examples: I couldn't hear her above the noise of the traffic.

meanings.definition: in or to a foreign country
examples: to be/go/travel/live abroad
She worked abroad for a year.
He was famous, both at home and abroad (= in his own country and in other countries).

meanings.definition: (formal) being talked about or felt by many people
examples: There was news abroad that a change was coming.

meanings.definition: (old use) outside; outdoors
[uncountable, countable] the fact of someone being away from a place where they are usually expected to be; the occasion or period of time when someone is away
examples: The decision was made in my absence (= while I was not there).
We did not receive any news during his long absence.
absence from… absence from work
repeated absences from school

meanings.definition: [uncountable] the fact of someone or something not existing or not being available; a lack of something
examples: The case was dismissed in the absence of any definite proof.
the absence of any women on the board of directors

meanings.definition: absent (from something) not in a place because of illness, etc.
examples: to be absent from school

meanings.definition: absent (from something) not present in something
examples: absent (from something) not present in something

meanings.definition: showing that you are not really looking at or thinking about what is happening around you
examples: an absent expression
